en: [Letter] 1804 Apr. 4, Knoxville, [Tennessee, to] Colo[nel] Hugh Montgomery / J[ohn] Sevier: a machine-readable transcription of an image

This document is a letter written by Governor John Sevier (1796-1801, 1803-1809) to Colonel Hugh Montgomery on April 4, 1804. The letter states that people have illegally settled on Indian lands and that troops are going to be employed to remove them. Sevier instructs Montgomery to warn these settlers of the dangers to which they will be exposed if they trespass on Indian lands.

none: [Letter] 1804 Apr. 4, Knoxville, [Tennessee, to] Colo[nel] Hugh Montgomery / J[ohn] Sevier: a machine-readable transcription of an image : page 1

body.value: Knoxville 4 April 1804 Sir Permit me to trouble you with An address which I beg you to forward directed to the inhabit people said to be settled and intruding upon the Indian lands. I am officially informed by the Agent of the War department that there is a considerable number of those persons settled on those lands, and I also understand that the regular troops are shortly is about to be employed for their removal I therefore deem it expedient to fore warn forewarn them give them information of the dangers they may be expose d themselves to, should they be found trespassing as has been to me represented I have the honor C et cetera J. John Sevier Colo. Colonel Hugh Montgomery Anderson County
